abstract: Unlike their Senate counterparts, who treated Jamie Dimon of JPMorgan Chase with deference last week, House lawmakers demanded answers about the bank’s multibillion-dollar trading loss.
snippet: Unlike their Senate counterparts, who treated Jamie Dimon of JPMorgan Chase with deference last week, House lawmakers demanded answers about the bank’s multibillion-dollar trading loss.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Jamie Dimon, the chief executive of JPMorgan Chase, tussled with lawmakers on Tuesday in his second showdown in Washington since JPMorgan, the nation’s largest bank, disclosed a multibillion-dollar trading loss.

headline.main: Dimon, Testifying Before House, Stays on Message
headline.print_headline: In House, Reception for Dimon Not So Friendly

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)

byline.original: By Jessica Silver-Greenberg, Ben Protess and Michael J. de la Merced
